alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Jackson; Jennings (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:19AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Decatur, southeastern Brown, southern Bartholomew, eastern Lawrence, Jackson and Jennings Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 419 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Santee to 6 miles north of Brownstown. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Decatur, southeastern Brown, southern Bartholomew, eastern Lawrence, Jackson and Jennings Counties, including the following locations... Westport, Hayden, Norman, Heltonville, Letts, Paris Crossing, Waymansville, Freetown, Butlerville and Crothersville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 37 and 64. Interstate 74 between mile markers 137 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
